column2: Bootstrapping your way to faster websites
What you'll do
Learn to use Bootstrap, one of the fastest and most popular web libraries out there!
See you later!

"Uh-oh! Looks like Sublime Text isn't installed! You need to download it from the App Center because we'll be using it for this activity. Click the icon named App Center on the Desktop, then search for Sublime Text, and install it.
Hiya, {{user_name}}! You've been doing some great website work so far - but I'm sure you've wondered if there was a really fast way to build a website.

Well, there is! There's lots of code out there in these big collections called libraries- grab one of those, and you've got a ton of basic (and sometimes advanced!) functions and pieces already figured out for you.

We've already hooked up all the Bootstrap bits for you - it's going to do all the heavy lifting so you can concentrate on designing the website. Let's take a look at the toolbox you'll use. If your browser doesn’t open, click on the following link: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.4/components/
These Components are all included in Bootstrap. All you have to do is paste some code into your webpage, and then they'll show up in their full glory.
Ok, let's get started on your webpage. If your browser doesn’t open, click on the following link: https://codepen.io/Hack-Computer/pen/ExamVOm
You're already familiar with Codepen - let's add some Bootstrap bits to the site.

Let's add a Carousel to your page - lots of websites have these, it's that big image at the top that changes every so often. Go back to your Bootstrap Comonents page and on the left side, there's a scrolling section - Click on the Carousel link, it's the 7th down from the top.

In the center section, under the Carousel heading, find the section called With controls. Just under the image, you’ll see a bit of code with a copy link at the top right corner. Click the link to copy the code.
Go back to your CodePen, and paste that code (Ctrl + V) onto line 10 of the HTML pane. You won't notice a huge change in the preview, because we haven't set up any images yet. Let's do that now.

In the HTML pane, find the first img src="..." section and replace the ... with https://bit.ly/happycat1 Don't forget to keep the quotation marks. :) The line should look like this: <img src="https://bit.ly/happycat1" class="d-block w-100" alt="...">
Boom, the Carousel appeared with an image. Great job! Now do the same thing for the other two <img> tags using https://bit.ly/catpicture1 and https://bit.ly/gingie.
Awesome! Now your Carousel will rotate between three images.
Let's try adding another Bootstrap Component to your page - Let's use a Jumbotron, and show off some text in a big way!

Like we did for the Carousel, find the Jumbotron section on the left-hand side of the Bootstrap Components page. Click it, then scroll down in the main part of the page until you find the Fluid Jumbotron.
Underneath the Fluid Jumbotron text, you'll see another Copy link inside a grey block of code. Click the Copy link to copy the code.

Go back to your CodePen, and paste that code (Ctrl + V) under the Carousel code, on line 34. You should now see the same block that was displayed on the Bootstrap page just under your carousel. Cool, right?
Awesome! Nice job on the Jumbotron and Carousel, your site is beginning to look professional! Let's keep it going, and add one last Bootstrap Component - A card deck!

Head back to the Bootstrap Components page on Chrome, and find the Card section on the left-hand side. Click Cards, then look on the right side of the page, and find Card Decks. Click that text to jump right to that section.

Now that you're looking at the Card Decks, find the grey code box, and click the Copy link to copy the code. Go back to your CodePen, and paste that code (Ctrl + V) under the Fluid Jumbotron code, on line 41. Don't worry if it looks odd; we'll fix that in a minute.
Like the Carousel, the Card Deck will show up with no images at first, so let's add some. Find the img src="..." sections and replace the ... with https://bit.ly/happycat1

You did it! By completing this activity, you learned how to create a website using Bootstrap. You're a Web Designer! If you would like to save your work, ask for your parent's permission to create a Codepen account.
